title: Lux ult
body:
Been playing against Lux a lot lately and I'm a bit confused. I've stunned her and also knocked her back mid ult and it still goes off. It seems that you can't interrupt it. 

Is this the case? 

I swear when I play Lux my ult has been interrupted... Just looking for some clarification on how it works.

replies.body: Increase CD on ult like the other Ap casters.
If she dies, it won't go off.

Actually i think the wiki may be wrong with the laser after knock ups thing, i remember in an LCS game one Lux got knocked sideways and instead of the damage going onto the animation it has been knocked slightly to the right of its original animation. This was clarified because 2 people were next to each other and the one in the animation took no damage but the one next to him did.
Thanks all... that clears it up.

Cast times cannot be interrupted by crowd control effects. During the cast time, Lux will ignore crowd control effects but still suffers from them if the duration persists.
If Lux is displaced by a knockback or pull effect during the cast time, the laser will fire from the original point of casting.

-from wiki

pretty sure it doesn't get interrupted 

only when you die it stops


In my experience
Pretty sure it can't be interrupted once the red line appears, but can be cancelled before it appears, not sure since I don't play lux and haven't played in ages but I think that it's the case.
